intro: Waltheria hoehnei, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and requires well-drained soil and full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
